full_answer: Just ask me a question about the ocean! For example, you could ask 'What is an Argo float?' or 'Show me the temperature in the Indian Ocean.'

title: What are Argo floats?
preview: Learn about the robotic floats that collect ocean data.
full_answer: Argo floats are amazing robots that drift in the ocean and collect data like temperature and saltiness. They help scientists understand our oceans and climate.

title: What data do floats collect? ðŸ“Š
preview: See the key measurements like temperature , salinity , pressure , latitude & longitude , water trajectories.
full_answer: Argo floats primarily measure temperature, salinity (saltiness), and pressure (depth). Some advanced floats can also measure oxygen, nutrients, and even the pH of the water!

full_answer: Here are some common questions about the ocean. Click one to see the answer!
